channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pothole outside 132 Belmont road in middle of road, 2nd November
item.description:
There is a large pothole in the middle of the road that has been infilled on number of occasions as previously reported but the repair has always been inadequate and the hole appears to be getting longer due to the heavy traffic continuously going over it and damaging further. The road has been resurfaced at both ends but the middle section could do with being resurfaced
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General waste dumped, green bin stolen, 2nd November
item.description:

item.title: Another mattress dumped, 2nd November
item.description:
Another day, another flytipped mattress. Corner of Rainbow St and Dowlas Street PLEASE REMOVE THIS BIN. ALL IT DOES IS ATTRACT FLYTIPPING

item.title: Over hanging the, 2nd November
item.description:
This tree/trees are overhanging and is tied with a blue rope to hold it back, the dropped leaves block the drain which causes a massive puddle when it rains we lose maybe 3 cars parking spaces also the birds in the drop poop down on to all the cars it’s a mess please help thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Crescent, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins not collected, 2nd November
item.description:
The bins for the entirety of Weston Grove BR1 were not collected on 30/10/2025. The Council’s website says that they now won’t be collected until 13/11/2025. The bins are out on the street and overflowing with litter all around the place. This issue affects 70+ properties

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weston Grove, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass smashed and scattered on the pavement, 2nd November
item.description:
Bus Shelter B has been smashed yet again it was smashed on Friday night and repaired ( with glass ) on Saturday and then smashed again Saturday night again there’s glass all over the pavement which needs sweeping . I wondered if we could ask TfL to replace the glass with plastic because it must be costing a fortune to keep replacing it with glass night after night .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - smashed glass or panels / jagged metal edges on shelter

item.title: Green bins dumped, 2nd November
item.description:
3rd time reporting!! Green bins dumped Junction of Crayford rd and Heath rd opposite A1 Carriages in Crayford Rd Stinking disgusting full bins been flytipped and been reported 3 times Please get rid I don’t know why the bin man haven’t just emptied them on their usual rounds - they’ve been there for 6 weeks!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71, Crayford Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet
